issue.title: Simple Expense Tracker
issue.body:
## Build a simple expense tracker

A basic web app to track expenses.

**Core Features:**
1. Add expense (description, amount)
2. List all expenses  
3. Show total

**Tech:**
- Next.js 14 App Router
- Tailwind CSS
- Store data in memory (no database)

**Pages:**
- / - List expenses and total
- Add expense form on same page

ems.task: Initialize Next.js 14 project with App Router, configure Tailwind CSS, TypeScript, and create all foundational configuration files (package.json, tsconfig.json, .gitignore, tailwind.config.ts, next.config.js)
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Implement in-memory expense storage, data models/types, and core expense management logic (add, list, calculate total) in src/lib/storage.ts and src/types/index.ts

workers.task: Create TypeScript data models and types for expense tracking in src/types/index.ts
Implement in-memory expense storage with add, list, and calculate total methods in src/lib/storage.ts

ems.task: Build the complete UI using Next.js 14 App Router - create app/page.tsx with expense form, expense list, total display, and Tailwind styling

workers.task: Create the main page UI component at app/page.tsx with expense form (description input, amount input, submit button), expense list display, and total display using Tailwind CSS styling
Create expense list component at components/ExpenseList.tsx with ul/li rendering of expense items and Tailwind styling for list items
Create expense form component at components/ExpenseForm.tsx with form fields for description and amount, submit handler, and Tailwind CSS form styling

ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

analysisSummary: Implement a minimal Next.js 14 expense tracker with in-memory storage, featuring a single-page interface to add, list, and total expenses, styled with Tailwind CSS.
